intro: Cousinia fallax, commonly known as the desert cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with wiry stems and basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures. Cousinia fallax is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, making it a characteristic species of its native environment.
